data.headline: US futures up about 0.1% in quiet premarket trading ahead of January payrolls report
bullets: January jobs data expected to show 55,000–75,000 gains with unemployment near 4.4%
Potential prior payroll revisions could impact Fed June rate-cut expectations, the dollar, yields, and gold
Dow closed at a record high while S&P 500 and Nasdaq dipped on AI-linked financial weakness and sector laggards
Recent softness in retail sales and underperformance in software and financials weigh on sentiment
Sharp post-earnings declines in Mattel, Lyft, Moderna, and Robinhood highlight stock-specific risks
Moderna drops ~9% premarket after FDA refuses to file its flu vaccine application
Other notable premarket movers include Lyft, Cloudflare, Ford, Shopify, Zillow, and Kraft Heinz (after pausing a planned split)
Traders remain cautious as the dollar weakens and volatility is expected after the jobs data release
Key earnings from McDonald’s, Cisco, and Robinhood still to come
